intro: Sanicula orthacantha var. longispina, commonly known as the long-spined sanicula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rich, loamy soils. Its unique long, spiny bracts distinguish it from other varieties within the species.
